column4: hello all! hey, when i am doing apt-get install phpmyadmin its getting me the old ver of it, 1.2.. how can i make ubuntu know that there is newer version of it?... i tried apt-get update but its not helping so much... ... thanks!
Ubuntu doesn't just "know" about newer versions. people must package them. and packages are *never* updated in Ubuntu, except for security patches and bugfixes.
anyway, don't bother with backports, since phpmyadmin 3 isn't even in Intrepid, so no chance it gets backported this semester
